column4: I'm converting videos with mencoder, flv to avi.  I'm using "mencoder input.flv -o output.avi -ovc x264 -x264encopts threads=3:bitrate=500 -oac mp3lame -lameopts abr:br=52" I have a hyper-threaded machine, not sure if using the dual-core command applies, but should those commands give me the same quality as the original flv?
How would I check that the video is the same quality?
if you find a version of mencoder and filter strings that don't result in a/v lag, please let me know :-/
video won't be same quality obviously since you are re-encoding
question is if it is good enough for you
How much quality loss will I have though, a significant amount, as in 25% or more like 10%?
these aren't things you measure in percentages :-p
Do you have a better way I can convert the videos then?  Since you don't seem too fond of mencoder.
and do let me know if you find a combination and ubuntu mencoder package that don't have a/v desync
actually, I'm quite fond of it
I just can't seem to get it to elminate audio lag from flv, and is annoying me
By A/V sync, you mean the audio gets out of sync?  Do you know of any program that doesn't do that?  Does mencoder work with rm to avi as well?
and is possible to tweak the intervals to acceptable manually, and possibly more advanced tweaks I don't know about
and for all I know, is fixed in later mplayer
